headline.main: NORTH AND SOUTH.; The Approaching Executions at Charlestown TESTS OF SOUTHERN OPINION.

docs.lead_paragraph: Extensive preparations are making for the approaching executions. Nineteen companies of military are now on duty, and guards are stationed at every street corner and crossroad. Picket guards patrol the surrounding county, and six more companies are announced as on their way here.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamship Moses Taylor, S. P. GRIFFIN, Esq., commanding, from New-Orleans on the 5th, and from Havana on the 8th, arrived early yesterday morning. She experienced unvarying head winds throughout the passage.

headline.main: FROM CUBA.; Arrival of the Moses Taylor--Anticipated Departure of Gen. Concha--The Markets--Cruise of the United States Steamer Wyandotte--From the South Side of the Island.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Moses Taylor, S. P. GRIFFIN, Esq., commanding, from New-Orleans on the 5th, and from Havana on the 8th, arrived early yesterday morning. She experienced unvarying head winds throughout the passage.

headline.main: FROM THE PACIFIC COAST.; The Mission of Gen, Scott at San Juan, Resumption of Hostilities Between Parm and Ecuador INTERESTING FROM CALIFORNIA. ARRIVAL OF THE ATLANTIC. Nearly Two Milions of Treasure, THE REVOLUTION IN NEW-GRANADA.

docs.snippet: Capt. Wm. O. Johnson, late of ship Mastiff, burned at sea, has returned to Salem (Mass.) in good health. The Register says that his wife has also recovered from the fatigue and excitement consequent upon the dangers to which she was exposed. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. Wm. O. Johnson, late of ship Mastiff, burned at sea, has returned to Salem (Mass.) in good health. The Register says that his wife has also recovered from the fatigue and excitement consequent upon the dangers to which she was exposed. The ex-King of Oude is said to have accepted a pension of twelve laes, (pound 120,000,) and relinquished all claims on Oude.

docs.snippet: DOING PENANCE FOR A FOLLY.--Since BEN PERLEY POORE trundled a barrel of apples from Newbury to Boston as a forfeit for betting on the election of Mr. FILLMORE, sanguine politicians seldom allow an important election to pass without agreeing to do...
docs.lead_paragraph: DOING PENANCE FOR A FOLLY.--Since BEN PERLEY POORE trundled a barrel of apples from Newbury to Boston as a forfeit for betting on the election of Mr. FILLMORE, sanguine politicians seldom allow an important election to pass without agreeing to do some absurd thing by way of demonstrating their confidence in the success of their favorite candidate.

headline.main: PARISIAN TOPICS.; A Russian Grand Duchess--One of the Heroes of Solferino--A Political Humanitarian--Story of the Chereau Abduction--A Specific for Asthma -- Medical Memoranda -- Anecdote of Alexander Dumas.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Grand Duchess MARIA, of Russia, is just now the astonishment of the Parisians. The Princess' reputation for beauty and practical good sense had preceded her to Paris, and although this is the first time she has ever visited the French capital, she was hardly a stranger to its best society.

docs.snippet: The reduction of fares, and a high and safe increase of speed for City, suburban, and "accommodation" passenger traffic, by saving untold millions of cents and half-hours, and by expanding the practical boundaries of cities and large towns, would...
docs.lead_paragraph: The reduction of fares, and a high and safe increase of speed for City, suburban, and "accommodation" passenger traffic, by saving untold millions of cents and half-hours, and by expanding the practical boundaries of cities and large towns, would result in more substantial good to the public at large, than would the completion of the Pacific Railroad or the Atlantic Telegraph.

docs.lead_paragraph: Death of Hon. Theodore Sedgwick. ACTION OF THE COURTS--EULOGIES BY MESSRS. CHARLES O'CONNOR, WILLIAM CURTIS NOYES, DAVID DUDLEY FIELD, AND OTHERS--ADJOURNMENTS. On Thursday night, Hon. THEODORE SEDGWICK, United States District-Attorney for the Southern District of this State, died,

headline.main: SCHILLER FEST AT MUNICH.; Royal Countenance--The Preparations--Torchlight Demonstrations-Scenes in the Lager Shops--Ceremonies at the Odeon.

docs.lead_paragraph: To-day is the last day of the Schiller Fest in Munich. It has been celebrated here under the most favorable circumstances, the Government granting all the requests of the Committee, and the people taking a lively interest and an active part in the proceedings.
